title: YTX14-BS Battery - Motorcycle Battery, ATV Battery 12V 12AH, UTV, 4 Wheeler, Snowmobile, Powersports Batteries - Compatible with Honda Rancher 350, Buell Blast, Yamaha - Sealed Lead Acid 12 Volt AGM
features: 12V 12AH Battery Compatible with Yuasa YTX14-BS battery, EST-TX14 battery, ETX14-BS, CTX14-BS, YTX14BS, ES14BS, 14-BS, YTX14 BS for ATVs, UTVs, Motorcycles, Personal Watercraft, Scooter, Jet Skis, Snowmobiles. 4 Wheeler, Powersport, Generator & More!

12V Motorcycle Battery YTX14-BS is a Factory Activated (Already Charged), Maintenance Free, Sealed Lead Acid Battery that comes ready to install. Quick and easy installation with leak free, sealed design prevents corrosion and ensures a long life.
12V ATV Battery ETX14 Compatible with Honda Fourtrax 300, Rancher 350, 420, Foreman 450, 500, VTX 1300, Pioneer 1000 Plus Other UTV Battery & 4 Wheeler Battery 12 Volt
High Quality, Built to Last & Reliable Performance and Power even in extreme weather conditions & temperature. Perfect for extended rides, off-road adventures and camping trips.
YTX14 battery can be mounted in any positions & high resistance to shocks and vibration which makes it ideal for rugged terrains. Compatible with Mercedes Backup Auxiliary 2115410001.

reviews.text: Battery worked as expected with no issues.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2025
reviews.title: Good price and quality.

reviews.text: Shipping took a little while but being a hazardous item these things happen. Three months ago I got my bike out of the shop but needed to get a battery first. The only one they had in stock was a Lithium Ion that cost $200 but he told me all the benefits to it and that it was worth the money (don't believe it). Rode it twice before moving and when I got here she wouldn't start. First it was a slow crank then NOTHING, no power at all, no lights. I got a lithium ion battery charger and it showed that the battery had a full charge. I spent the next couple of weeks (between unpacking and putting furniture together) looking for a blown fuse or disconnected wire. Nothing worked and I was preparing to send it to the shop again. Then my neighbor told me that he was told those lithium batteries are worthless, something about the microchip in them giving trouble. I did not think he was right so I decided to just get the least expensive battery I could find for my bike and see. When it arrived I hooked it up to the charger but within 30 seconds it said it was fully charged. I was worried that the battery may not fit because it is wider than the OEM one, but it fit perfectly without ANY issues. I connected the cable and she fired right up! This battery will fit a Yamaha V-Star 1100 without any problems and it works great!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 3, 2024
reviews.title: Great battery for 2009 Yamaha V-Star 1100

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2025
reviews.title: Best product for the money

reviews.text: This review is subject to change. I ordered the battery and it came as expected. Packaging was ok, and no physical damage to the battery. Since it claimed to be factory charged and activated, I put my snap-on battery tester on it to make sure it actually was and in good condition. Voltage showed 12.62VDC @ 194CCA, and it said replace battery. So I charged it overnight on a low and slow 2A charger. When I came back to recheck it, it said 13.42VDC @ 177CCA and again to replace battery. So during charging it lost cold cranking amps, indicating to me that this battery is likely just a refurbished job being sold as new. Price point was good though. But because of the low price point I decided I should check to ensure what Iâ€™m getting is as advertised. And itâ€™s not. Iâ€™ve put in for a replacement, and will update with how that one turns out when it arrives. However, I do suspect this is a common occurrence since other reviews have said it will no longer keep a charge after a short period of time, which is exactly how this one would have performed if I installed it before checking it first. Update: 9/15/25 Ordered a replacement battery in exchange for the one I originally posted. I didnâ€™t bother pulling this one all the way out of the box or getting all the plastic off it before testing it. This confirms my original theory. Tested as soon as I opened it. 12.62VDC @ 196CCA which is 54% capacity of CCA or cold cranking amps. Meaning, this battery is already failed. But donâ€™t let me dissuade you. If you need a battery of this size just to get you through, say finishing out a mowing season for your mower and you donâ€™t want to spend the money, this will work. However, this battery will not last. It will eventually fail within a couple weeks to months and will not take a charge any longer, leaving you to replace it again, especially if itâ€™s going to sit for prolonged periods like a mower during the winter. This battery will get you by, but is not a long term solution. So purchase being fully aware of what youâ€™re getting. If Iâ€™m being completely honest, the seller already knows this, and thatâ€™s why this battery is half the cost of a new name brand like Yuasa. For half the cost, you get half the capacity.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2025
reviews.title: Bad battery out of the box

reviews.text: This YTX14-BS battery is the real MVP of my garage. After flawless performance in my ATV, I grabbed a second one for my snowmobileâ€”because why mess with success? It fires up faster than I do on Monday mornings and doesnâ€™t flinch in cold weather. Sealed AGM means zero maintenance (and zero mess), which is exactly my style. Fits perfectly in my Honda Rancher and even powered up my dusty old Buell Blast like it owed it money. Reliable, powerful, and drama-freeâ€”just how I like my batteries.

globalReviews.title: Respecte les dimension câ€™est important merci

globalReviews.text: The battery arrived quickly and worked perfectly for about two weeks before completely dying. My guess is that it had a bad cell or some internal defect. I understand that these things can happen, but the vendor, Infinisia, is by far the worst seller I have ever dealt with. Trying to initiate an exchange or return through them is nearly impossible. The automated phone system tells you to press 3 for returns and then hangs up every single time. A full week of emails went unanswered. Thankfully, I escalated the issue through Amazon, and they handled it promptly by issuing a refund. Iâ€™m not upset that the battery failed, things break, but I am completely disappointed in this third-party seller. Never again.

I used to own motorcycles, but now, only cars. I still have knowledge from my motorcycle days. Most recent production cars require an aux battery due to the auto engine stop on idle eco feature. The list of usable batteries is not very openly documented. In fact auto manufacturers would prefer to deceive consumers only to buy their genuine battery for a much higher price. My car in question has a base tray size of ~3.5 inch by ~6 inch for the aux battery. Height for the original battery is 5.1 inch (more like a 10Ah size). However, any battery with the correct base size could work. Height is only relative when ample headroom is available. This particular battery (YTX14-BS, 12Ah) is well constructed with a very even weight distribution. Being sealed is great with no requirement for a breather tube. The whole battery block is finished well without any sharp edges. With this leak proof feature, it is even better suited for use as an Aux Battery for cars. It has a height of 5.9 inch so I had to lengthen the strap that secures the battery to accommodate the extra 0.8 inch height. When all is done, the battery sits securely and functions within specifications. The photo shows the original battery at 5.1 inch high. There is plenty of room to accommodate a 5.9 inch high battery. Lengthening the strap will do the trick.

They appreciate its value for money and report that their ATVs start right up with it. The battery life receives mixed feedback - while some say it works as advertised, others report it failing within a few weeks. Power performance is also mixed, with some customers noting it comes fully charged while others mention it doesn't have enough power.
